greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of nonnegative integers: a(1) = 0, a(2) = 1, a(2n) = 2*a(n), a(2n+1) = 1 + 2*a(A064989(2n+1)).
comment: Note the indexing: the domain starts from 1, while the range includes also zero.
See also the comments at A163511, which is the inverse permutation to this one.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1024
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: For n > 1, A007814(a(n)) = A007814(n) - A209229(n). [This map  preserves the 2-adic valuation of n, except when n is a power of two, in which cases it is decremented by one.]
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
(Scheme, with memoizing definec-macro from _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library)
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, (1 if i==2 else prevprime(i)**f[i] for i in f))
def a(n): return n - 1 if n<3 else 2*a(n//2) if n%2==0 else 1 + 2*a(a064989(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 15 2017
xref: Cf. A156552 (variant with inverted binary code), A253566, A332215, A332811, A334859 (other variants).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 20 2014
